intro: Sceletium varians, commonly known as the "Kanna" plant, is a flowering shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its leaves contain psychoactive compounds, including kanna alkaloids, which have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. Sceletium varians is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been studied for potential therapeutic applications.
